result.execSummary:
The defendant Malik A Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the amount to date of $931.38  as follows:  $104.00 to the BMO Harris Bradley Center; $425.00 to City of Milwaukee Tow Lot; and $402.38 to Wheaton Franciscan Medical Center.  
Restitution hearing June 19, 2015 to determine balance.
**6/25/2015  Court set $11,242.00 to Brandon W.  To be paid from prison funds not to exceed 25% and to be taken by DOC.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and fees.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:    All to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in ful would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.  No controlled substances or alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not already taken.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: per remittitur dated July 25, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP001168 CRNM,  IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on June 13, 2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Russell J. A. Jones is relieved of furhter representation of Jenkins in these matters.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published and may not be cited except as provided under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.23(3).

records.addlTxt: per order dated August 8, 2016, Appeal 2016AP1168CRNM, Within ten days of the date of this order, counsel shall make arrangements for preparation, filing, and service of the June 25, 2015 transcript in this matter.  Within fifteen days of the date of this order, counsel shall file a supplemental statement on transcript with this court and the cirucuit court. The Court reporter shall prepare, filing, and serve the transcript within thirty days of counsel's requests. The reporter may seek extension of time from this court if necessary. if the transcript was previously prepared but not filed, the court reporter shall file transcript in the circuit court within five days of counsel's request. Counsel shall be responsible for advising the court reporter of the deadlines set forth herein. Counsel may provide the reporter with a copy of this order if necessary. Within five days of the filing of the transcript in the circuit court, the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit the transcript, and any other documents filed pursuant to this order, to this court via supplemental return.

Defendant Malik A Jenkins in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Malik A Jenkins in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution hearing proceeds.  Victim was here, but had to leave.  Parties indicate they have reached a stipulation regarding restitution in this case.  Court set $11,242.00 to Brandon W.  to be paid from prison funds not to exceed 25% and to be taken by the Department of Conditions.  All other terms and conditions of bail continue.

Assistant District Attorney James W. Frisch appeared in court.  Defendant Malik A. Jenkins is in custody, and was not produced.  Defense counsel did not appear for the hearing on today's date.  Case is adjourned before Branch 20 on 6/25/15 at 8:30 a.m., on a date when defense counsel is present.

Defendant Malik A Jenkins in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Malik A Jenkins in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the State moved to dismiss and read in Count 2.  Court granted State's motion and ordered Count 2 dismissed but read in.  Plea hearing proceeds.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.     Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 20.

Defendant Malik A Jenkins in court (bull pen) with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Malik A Jenkins in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense  was in Judge Konkol's court the entire morning requesting an adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.

Defendant Malik A Jenkins in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Malik A Jenkins in custody.  Ron Dague for James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Karl Wallich-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
